phishingScenarios.title: Bank Account Suspension
phishingScenarios.description: You receive an email claiming your bank account will be suspended

email.subject: URGENT: Account Suspension Notice - Action Required
email.body:
Dear Valued Customer,

We have detected suspicious activity on your account. To prevent unauthorized access, your account will be suspended in 24 hours unless you verify your identity immediately.

Click here to verify: http://yourbank-security.com/verify

If you do not take action, your account will be permanently closed.

Best regards,
Security Team

redFlags: Suspicious domain (yourbank-security.com instead of official bank domain)
phishingScenarios.explanation: This is a phishing attempt. Legitimate banks use their official domain and would never threaten to close your account via email. Always contact your bank directly using official contact information.

phishingScenarios.title: PayPal Security Alert
phishingScenarios.description: You receive an email about unusual login activity

email.subject: Security Alert: Unusual Login Activity Detected
email.body:
Hello,

We noticed a login to your PayPal account from a new device in New York, NY on December 15, 2024 at 2:34 PM.

If this was you, no further action is needed.

If this wasn't you, please secure your account immediately by logging in and changing your password.

To review your account activity, visit: https://www.paypal.com/security

PayPal Security Team

phishingScenarios.explanation: This appears to be a legitimate security alert from PayPal. It uses the official domain, provides specific details, and directs you to the official website rather than a suspicious link.

phishingScenarios.title: Amazon Order Confirmation
phishingScenarios.description: You receive an email about an Amazon order you didn't place

email.subject: Your Amazon Order #123-4567890
email.body:
Thank you for your order!

Order Details:
- Item: iPhone 15 Pro Max
- Price: $1,199.00
- Delivery: December 20, 2024

If you did not place this order, click here immediately to cancel: http://amazon-orders.net/cancel

Amazon Customer Service

phishingScenarios.explanation: This is a phishing attempt. The domain is not Amazon's official domain, and legitimate order confirmations would come from amazon.com. If you're concerned about unauthorized orders, log into your Amazon account directly.

phishingScenarios.title: Microsoft Account Security
phishingScenarios.description: You receive an email about your Microsoft account

email.subject: Unusual sign-in activity
email.body:
We detected something unusual about a recent sign-in to your Microsoft account.

Sign-in details:
- Date and time: December 15, 2024 at 3:45 PM
- Location: Seattle, WA
- Device: iPhone

If this was you, you can ignore this email.

If this wasn't you, your account may have been compromised. Go to https://account.microsoft.com/security to secure your account.

Thanks,
The Microsoft account team

phishingScenarios.explanation: This appears to be a legitimate security notification from Microsoft. It uses the official Microsoft domain, provides specific details about the sign-in, and directs you to the official Microsoft security page.

phishingScenarios.title: Netflix Account Update
phishingScenarios.description: You receive an email about updating your Netflix payment information

email.subject: Payment Method Expired - Update Required
email.body:
Your Netflix subscription payment method has expired.

To continue enjoying Netflix, please update your payment information immediately.

Click here to update: http://netflix-support.com/update-payment

Your account will be suspended if payment is not updated within 48 hours.

Netflix Billing Team

phishingScenarios.explanation: This is a phishing attempt. Netflix uses netflix.com for all official communications. If you need to update payment information, log into your Netflix account directly through the official website.
